import numpy as np # linear algebra

base_path = '/kaggle/input/beginners-cats-and-dogs'

df_train = pd.read_csv(os.path.join(base_path, 'Train.csv'))
df_test = pd.read_csv(os.path.join(base_path, 'Test.csv'))

print(f'df_train.shape: {df_train.shape}')
display(df_train.head())

print(f'df_test.shape: {df_test.shape}')
display(df_test.head())

%matplotlib inline
from matplotlib.pyplot import imshow
from PIL import Image

# file path
img_path = os.path.join(base_path, 'testing_set', 'testing_set', 'testing_1.jpg')

#read the image
im = Image.open(img_path)

#show image

source.11938696:
# skip the training part  -> get predicted label of testing data

# pred label
my_pred_label = np.random.choice(['0', '1'], len(df_test)) # the label is string format!

# prepare submit dataframe
df_submit = pd.read_csv(os.path.join(base_path, 'Test.csv'))
df_submit['label'] = my_pred_label

display(df_submit.head())
